title: Litbits: Brotherhood of St Laurence short story competition
text:
Morris Gleitzman Photo: Mediaxpress 
Short story competition 
A new national short story competition sponsored by the Brotherhood of St Laurence seeks stories – fictional or fact – of between 2000 and 5000 words that convey the experience of people facing hardship in their lives. There is a prize pool of $12,500, including a first prize of $5000. The judges are actor Cate Blanchett, former governor-general Quentin Bryce and writer Kate Grenville. See: bsl.org.au<http://specialevents.cmail1.com/t/r-i-fduuuuk-l-w/>
A Raft of Drafts 
A Raft of Drafts is a series of six workshopping sessions by poet Lizz Murphy, suitable for new and developing writers with a small folio of poems in progress. It's on October 10, 17, 24 and November 7, 14 and 21 from 11am to 1pm. Cost: $400 members, $350 concessional members, $465 non-members (includes 12 months of membership), $400 concessional non-members (includes 12 months of membership). Venue: E Block Seminar Room, Gorman Arts Centre. See: actwriters.org.au/events/upcoming-workshops-events.shtml#lizzmurphy2 .
Advertisement Short Fiction Critiquing Group 
Six small-group short story workshopping sessions (October 11, 18 and 25 and November 1, 8 and 15 from 2 to 4pm) by writer and editor Irma Gold, will help develop writing, editing and critiquing skills. Cost: $400 members, $350 concessional members, $465 non-members (includes 12 months of membership), $400 concessional non-members (includes 12 months of membership). Venue: E Block Seminar Room, Gorman Arts Centre. See: actwriters.org.au/events/upcoming-workshops-events.shtml#irmagold .
Morris Gleitzman Dinner 
A Literary Dinner with children's author Morris Gleitzman will be held on Friday, October 9 at 6.30pm at the  Pavilion Hotel, 242 Northbourne Avenue. More information:  alea.edu.au/events/event/ gleitzmanliterarydinner .
What's on: 
October 3: CONFLUX 11, Canberra's annual speculative fiction convention, is on at Novotel Canberra Civic Centre. Special guests are author Isobelle Carmody and editor Tehani Wessely. See: conflux.org.au .
October 6: Author Susan Johnson will discuss her novel The Landing , about life and love, at Muse, Ground Floor, East Hotel, 69 Canberra Avenue, Kingston at 7.30pm. Admission $10 include a drink.Bookings: musecanberra.com.au .
October 6: A combined ANU/ Canberra Times Meet the Author free event with the ABC's Big Ideas program will feature a panel including Professor Gabriele Bammer and advertising and media personality Dee Madigan. They will discuss Change! Combining Analytical Approaches with Street Wisdom . China in the World Auditorium. Fellows Lane, ANU. 6pm. Bookings 6125 8415.
October 8:  Moments , a collection of short stories by Subhash Jaireth,  will be launched at the National Library Bookshop at 6pm. RSVP: 62621424
October 8: MasterChef winner and Australian UNESCO ambassador on nutrition Adam Liaw will be speaking on his new Asian cookbook. The dinner will have an Asian theme. The Hall, University House, ANU. 6.15pm for 7pm. $60. Bookings 6125 5269.
October 11: The Imaginarium Family Day at the National Library of Australia from 1 to 4pm features interactive demonstrations, the grand final of the ACT Scrabble competition, paper planes with the Paper Pilots, exploring the realm of riddles with David Astle, children's authors Pauline Deeves, Stephanie Owen Reeder and Tania McCartney, and more. Free, no bookings required. See: nla.gov.au/event/imaginarium-family-day .
October 11: The Canberra launch of In Yer Face: The Bald Archy Prize by Peter Batey and Fran Henke​ will be held at Paperchain Bookstore Manuka at 2.45 for 3pm. RSVP: telephone 6295 6723.
October 12: David Astle will talk about the world of riddles and his book Riddledom: 101 Riddles and Their Stories in an author talk at the National Library of Australia at 6pm. Conference Room, Foyer, Level 4. Cost: $10.See: nla.gov.au/event/author-talk-david-astle .
October 13: Ramona Koval will discuss her memoir Bloodhound: Searching For My Father , about her search for the unsettling truths behind her parents' troubled past, at Muse, Ground Floor, East Hotel, 69 Canberra Avenue, Kingston at 7.30pm. Admission $10 include a drink.Bookings: musecanberra.com.au .
October 14: Former chairman and managing director of the ABC, David Hill, will speak on his new book, A ustralian and the Monarchy . Manning Clark 3, ANU. 6.30pm. Free. Bookings 6125 8415.
October 25: Charlotte Wood will be in conversation at Muse, East Hotel, 69 Canberra Avenue, Kingston at 3.30pm about her novel The Natural Way of Things , an exploration of contemporary misogyny and corporate control. Admission $10 includes a drink. Bookings: musecanberra.com.au .
